language_as_recorded: In Arabic, with Farsi translations of main Arabic text in red beneath each line
physical_description: Extent: 1 item (2 unnumbered pages); illuminations; 31 x 19 cm
note: Layout: Single column of 24 lines each on recto and verso, alternating between main Arabic text and Farsi translations.|Binding: Unbound.|Fragment from a manuscript copy of the Qur'an, surah 22 (al-Ḥajj) verses 1-15, with commentary and red, blue, and gold illustrations in margins.|Title devised by cataloger.

title_as_recorded: Book of hours (orbi terre) manuscript leaf
genre_as_recorded: Manuscripts, Latin (Medieval and modern)|Book of hours
physical_description: Extent: 1 unnumbered leaf (that is, 2 unnumbered pages); parchment, ink; 195 x 150 mm, in pamphlet binder 305 mm
note: Layout: single column, 20 lines|Script: Gothic; ruled in red; one 2-line initial letter "A", opening Psalm 77(78), in blue outlined in red; twenty 1-line initial versal letters some in alternating red and blue outlined in alternating blue and red, marking the first letter in each verse.|Condition: a few holes affecting text.|Title devised by cataloger.|Former call number: UCR028.|Recto has Psalm 76(77):19-21 and Psalm 77(78):1-6. Verso has Psalm 77(78):6-16.|Incipit: orbi terr[a]e: co[m]ota est [e]t contremuit ter[ra]|Explicit: eos velutin abysso multa. Et edux[it].

former_owner_as_recorded: Augustus Frederick, Prince, Duke of Sussex, 1773-1843|McClure, Edmund, d. 1922|Foot, Isaac, 1880-1960
physical_description: Extent: 128 leaves (that is, 256 unnumbered pages); 110 x 90 mm, in box 125 x 101 x 40 mm
note: Layout: 2 columns, 32 lines|Binding: Bound in vellum; some margins shaved.|Ms. of hours, according to Dominican use, written in semi-gothic script on vellum. Rubricated; colored initials. Illuminated initials with gold decoration on leaves 7b, 41b, 50b, 60a, and 83a. No colophon.|Provenance: Heraldic bookplate with pencilled note "From Duke of Sussex Library" in front; at end, bookplate of Edmond McClure, A.M. (20th century); from Isaac Foot collection.|Former call number: UCR002.|On flyleaf: Psalterium et hymnarium cod. pulcher memb. c. lit. initial. illum. saec. XV.|Calendar is Dominican or Franciscan.
